page.title: 20TRANSPORT IN TERLING
page.content: 1985 has seen a reduction in bus services here. We now have an Eastern National bus each Wednesday leaving Terling at 9.34am for Braintree and returning to the Rayleigh Arms at 1.25pm. This costs Â£1.20 return at present. Boons Coaches run a bus service to Witham every Thursday, leaving Terling Post Office at 9.27am and arriving back at 1.16pm. This costs 70pence return fare. The village is also served by a Country Car service which costs Â£1.05 return. This runs to Braintree and Witham every Saturday. A coach takes the secondary school children out of the village to Black Notley School. When a survey of how pupils travel to Terling school was made, it was found that 28 came by private car, 4 by taxi, 10 by mini bus, 21 walk and 3 come by bike.
